case_vignette:
A 2-day-old male is seen in the newborn nursery for repeated emesis and lethargy. He was born at 39 weeks to a 24-year-old mother following an uncomplicated pregnancy and birth. He has been breastfeeding every 2 hours and has 10 wet diapers per day. His father has a history of beta-thalassemia minor. Laboratory results are as follows:

Hemoglobin: 12 g/dL
Platelet count: 200,000/mm^3
Mean corpuscular volume: 95 µm^3
Reticulocyte count: 0.5%
Leukocyte count: 5,000/mm^3 with normal differential

Serum:
Na+: 134 mEq/L
Cl-: 100 mEq/L
K+: 3.3 mEq/L
HCO3-: 24 mEq/L
Urea nitrogen: 1 mg/dL
Creatinine: 0.6 mg/dL
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been throwing up repeatedly and feeling very tired.
Have you had any fever or abdominal pain?
No, I haven't had any fever or abdominal pain.
Have you had any recent changes in your appetite or weight?
Since I'm only a 2-day-old baby, it's a bit difficult to tell about appetite or weight changes beyond what's typical for newborns.
Have you been breastfed or given formula?
I have been breastfeeding every 2 hours.
Have you been given any medications or supplements?
No medications or supplements have been given to me.
Have you been born prematurely?
No, I was born at 39 weeks.
Have you been born to a mother with any medical conditions?
No, my pregnancy and birth were uncomplicated.
Final Diagnosis: Gastroenteritis.

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A 2-day-old baby is brought to the clinic due to repeated vomiting and excessive tiredness. The baby has not had any fever or abdominal pain. It is difficult to assess appetite and weight changes, as the baby is only 2 days old. The baby has been breastfeeding every 2 hours and has not been given any medications or supplements. The baby was born at 39 weeks and the pregnancy and birth were uncomplicated.
trial_0.vignette_frq: The most likely diagnosis is beta-thalassemia major.
trial_0.multiturn_mcq: Final Diagnosis: None of the above.
trial_0.summarized_mcq: The most likely diagnosis is Phenylketonuria (PKU).
trial_0.summarized_frq: The most likely diagnosis is gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).
